title: [18. 4Sum](https://leetcode.cn/problems/4sum/)
content:
| English | 简体中文 |
18. 4Sum Description Given an array nums of n integers, return an array of all the unique quadruplets [nums[a], nums[b], nums[c], nums[d]] such that:
0 <= a, b, c, d < n a, b, c, and d are distinct. nums[a] + nums[b] + nums[c] + nums[d] == target You may return the answer in any order.
 
Example 1:
Input: nums = [1,0,-1,0,-2,2], target = 0 Output: [[-2,-1,1,2],[-2,0,0,2],[-1,0,0,1]] Example 2:
Input: nums = [2,2,2,2,2], target = 8 Output: [[2,2,2,2]]  
Constraints:
1 <= nums.length <= 200 -109 <= nums[i] <= 109 -109 <= target <= 109 Related Topics Array Two Pointers Sorting Similar Questions Two Sum 3Sum 4Sum II Count Special Quadruplets
